subject: Re: JUnit add-on for historical/statistical/trend analysis?
msgSnippet: ... Just use ant! Create a custom xsl transformation to extract the statistics you want from the junit report to a properties file:
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "kirkandsheila" <kirk@...> wrote:
>
> Hi all,
>
> I'm doing some research to determine what products/projects are out
> there to perform historical/statistical/trend analysis on JUnit
> results. Ideally, I'd like to be able to break down the JUnit results
> that can be filtered, aggregated, and so forth for reports.
>
> I've seen posts that promote/suggest Clover and Agitar. I've seen
> several posts that inquire of free or open source solutions, but
> without many answers - plus they're a year or two old. I'm still not
> sure if Clover is what I'm looking for (I want to see the results for
> test run success/failure/time/regressions/etc., not the coverage of
> the product in terms of unit tests).
>
> Are there any products/projects out there to perform reporting on
> JUnit runs besides Agitar?
>
> Thanks,
> Kirk
>
Just use ant!

Create a custom xsl transformation to extract the statistics you want
from the junit report to a properties file:

<xslt in="${reports.tests}/TEST-org.foo.AllTests.xml"
out="AllTests.properties" style="./testreport.xsl" />

Read the properties:
<property file="AllTests.properties" />

Write them to a text file with a timestamp
<echo file="${history.txt}" append="true">
${date.time};alltests.count;${alltests.count}
${date.time};alltests.fails.count;${alltests.fails.count}
${date.time};alltests.success.count;${alltests.success.count}
</echo>

Now use a statistical analysis tool of choice (say a spreadsheet) to
analyse the log.

A similar technique can be used for any ant task that produces an xml
format report eg. cobertura-report for code coverage.

/Steven
